topic.title: How to create a certificate authority?
topic.body: I'm new here and still trying to explore more about ZeroNet. Now I want to now if as a decentralized network anyone can create your own CA? How it's possible?

topic.title: Encrypt user data
topic.body: is possible do something similar to: clone a ZeroChat (http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:99:ZeroChat+tutorial+(new)) and make messages encrypted? all messages will be stored in users path and anyone peer can read data, only when user visit the website and website will get the user private key to decrypt it. so only the user can read your stored data. is it possible? ZeroNet documentation is too poor

1567636834_1KeYAouLFhS2WxAbfS8hdYXSN1zDc.body:
> [filips](#comment_181_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): You can look to ZeroID or KxoID source code for some details. For more simple ID providers, see KaffieID, PeakID, PolarID or CryptoID source code.

Thanks. they dont enable to clone their website
